page.title: 14CHURCHES
page.content: ST GEORGES CHURCH The earliest reference to a church on this site is 1199, but basicly dates from the 1400s ST MARTINS CHURCH The present building was erected in 1430. Within it there is a monument to Sir William Cecil, a local court member, who died in 1599 ALL SAINTS CHURCH This church is probably one of the churches in the domesday book. The spire is 152ft high ST JOHNS CHURCH This is in the perpendicular style of the 14th-15th century. It is similar to St. Martins ST MICHAELS CHURCH A church stood here from 1158, but it has recently been closed down due to the movement of population away from the centre, and it has been sold for redevelopment. ST MARYS CHURCH The earliest records of this church date back to 1146. The tower and spire cannot fail to awaken admiration.The roof is also very fine.
